Post-organ transplant rehabilitation aims to improve physical function and quality of life. Physiotherapy includes aerobic exercises, strengthening, and functional training. Organ transplant rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-prostatectomy pelvic floor rehabilitation aims to improve urinary continence and sexual function. Physiotherapy includes pelvic floor exercises, biofeedback, and electrical stimulation. Kegel exercises are often used.

Post-heart transplant exercise tolerance training aims to improve cardiovascular fitness and functional capacity. Physiotherapy includes aerobic exercise, strength training, and monitoring heart rate. Graded exercise programs are used.

Post-fracture Dupuytren's contracture rehabilitation aims to improve hand function and reduce contractures. Physiotherapy includes stretching, splinting, and manual therapy. Dupuytren's protocols are used.

Post-spinal cord stimulator rehabilitation aims to improve pain control and functional capacity. Physiotherapy includes postural correction, strengthening exercises, and activity modification. Device management is important.

Post-fracture Achilles tendinopathy rehabilitation aims to reduce pain and improve tendon function. Physiotherapy includes eccentric exercises, stretching, and orthotic management. Achilles tendinopathy protocols are used.

Post-fracture ankylosing spondylitis rehabilitation aims to improve spinal mobility and reduce pain. Physiotherapy includes stretching, strengthening, and postural correction. Ankylosing spondylitis protocols are used.

Post-fracture reactive arthritis with circinate balanitis rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function, considering genital involvement. Physiotherapy includes tailored exercises, pain management, and functional training. Reactive arthritis circinate protocols are used.

Post-fracture reactive arthritis with nail changes rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function, considering nail involvement. Physiotherapy includes tailored exercises, pain management, and functional training. Reactive arthritis nail protocols are used.

Post-tendon transfer rehabilitation aims to improve muscle function and restore movement. Physiotherapy includes gentle range of motion exercises, strengthening, and activity modification. Splinting is common in early phases.

Post-thoracic surgery rib cage mobilization aims to improve chest wall expansion and reduce pain. Physiotherapy includes manual therapy, stretching, and breathing exercises. Postural correction is important.

Scoliosis management involves correcting spinal curvature and improving posture. Physiotherapy includes specific scoliosis exercises, bracing, and postural education. The Schroth method is often used.

Post-hypersensitivity pneumonitis rehabilitation aims to improve respiratory function and reduce dyspnea. Physiotherapy includes breathing exercises, aerobic exercises, and functional training. Hypersensitivity pneumonitis rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-fracture reactive arthritis with enthesitis rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function, considering inflammation at tendon and ligament insertion sites. Burn rehabilitation aims to prevent contractures, reduce scarring, and restore function. Physiotherapy includes stretching, splinting, and scar management. Hydrotherapy can be beneficial for pain relief and wound care.

Post-bone marrow transplant fatigue management aims to improve energy levels and quality of life. Physiotherapy includes graded exercise therapy, energy conservation techniques, and sleep hygiene education. Relaxation techniques are used.

Myofascial pain syndrome rehabilitation aims to reduce muscle pain and improve function. Physiotherapy includes manual therapy, dry needling, and exercises. Myofascial pain syndrome rehabilitation protocols are used.
Post-burn skin graft management aims to improve graft adherence and reduce scarring. Physiotherapy includes splinting, stretching, and scar massage. Graft care education is crucial.

Mobility improvement focuses on increasing joint range of motion and functional movement. Physiotherapy uses stretching, joint mobilization, and functional exercises. Techniques like PNF stretching are commonly used.

Post-fracture undifferentiated spondyloarthritis rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function in patients with spondyloarthritis symptoms. Physiotherapy includes tailored exercises, pain management, and functional training. Undifferentiated spondyloarthritis protocols are used.

Post-fracture compartment syndrome management aims to reduce swelling and prevent complications. Physiotherapy includes edema management, range of motion exercises, and pain control. Wound care is vital.

Post-spinal fusion rehabilitation aims to improve spinal stability and function. Physiotherapy includes core strengthening, range of motion exercises, and functional activities. Spinal fusion rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-fracture reactive arthritis with endophthalmitis rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function, considering inflammation inside the eye. Physiotherapy includes tailored exercises, pain management, and functional training. Reactive arthritis endophthalmitis protocols are used.

Shoulder impingement rehabilitation aims to reduce pain and improve shoulder function. Physiotherapy includes manual therapy, exercises, and postural training. Shoulder impingement rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-fracture fibromyalgia rehabilitation aims to reduce widespread pain and improve function. Physiotherapy includes gentle aerobic exercise, stretching, and relaxation techniques. Fibromyalgia protocols are used.
Post-fracture coccydynia rehabilitation aims to reduce tailbone pain and improve sitting tolerance. Physiotherapy includes manual therapy, stretching, and pain control. Coccydynia protocols are used.

Post-fracture systemic sclerosis related arthritis rehabilitation aims to manage joint pain and improve function, considering the impact on skin and internal organs. Post-pleural effusion management aims to improve lung function and reduce dyspnea. Physiotherapy includes breathing exercises, postural drainage, and functional training. Pleural effusion management protocols are used.

Ligament injuries often involve sprains or tears, leading to joint instability. Physiotherapy focuses on reducing swelling, restoring stability, and strengthening supporting muscles. Proprioceptive exercises are often included.

Post-fracture Cogan's syndrome rehabilitation aims to manage pain and improve function, considering the impact on eyes and inner ear. Physiotherapy includes tailored exercises, pain management, and functional training. Cogan's syndrome protocols are used.

Virtual reality rehabilitation aims to improve motor and cognitive functions using virtual environments. Physiotherapy includes virtual reality games, simulations, and interactive exercises. Virtual reality rehabilitation protocols are used.

Total hip arthroplasty rehabilitation focuses on restoring hip function and reducing pain. Physiotherapy includes weight-bearing exercises, gait training, and hip abductor strengthening. Assistive devices are often used initially.

Cardiac rehabilitation focuses on improving cardiovascular fitness and reducing risk factors. Physiotherapy includes aerobic exercises, strength training, and education on lifestyle modifications. Monitoring heart rate is essential.

Multiple sclerosis rehabilitation aims to manage symptoms and improve function. Physiotherapy includes fatigue management, balance training, and spasticity management. MS rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-bone marrow transplant rehabilitation aims to improve physical function and quality of life. Physiotherapy includes aerobic exercises, strengthening, and functional training. Bone marrow transplant rehabilitation protocols are used.

Post-TBI rehabilitation aims to improve cognitive and motor functions. Physiotherapy includes cognitive training, motor control exercises, and functional activities. TBI rehabilitation protocols are used.
